law.catch_line: In this part the following words have the meanings indicated....

text.section: In this part the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Aggrieved person" means any person that claims to have been injured by a discriminatory housing practice.

"Conciliation" means the attempted resolution of issues raised by a complaint, or by the investigation of a complaint, through informal negotiations involving the aggrieved person, the respondent, and the Commission.
"Conciliation agreement" means a written agreement between the respondent and the complainant setting forth the resolution of the issues in conciliation.
"Discriminatory housing practice" means an act that is prohibited under § 20-705, § 20-706, § 20-707, or § 20-708 of this title.
"Prevailing party" has the meaning as judicially determined under 42 U.S.C. § 1988.
